pullRequest.title: Add support for disabling proactive authentication
pullRequest.bodyText:
Also enables JAX-RS pre match filters to modify the security context.
Fixes #6096
Fixes #6105

nodes.bodyText: Note that this is because I need to add a new method to an interface in quarkus-security. If this PR is otherwise fine I will add it and cut a release.

nodes.bodyText:
Why is this mapper needed ?
I also may have seen ForbiddenException and/or UnauthorizedException thrown on some JAX-RS paths too
What is a deferred identity ? Update: after looking through the PR I believe it represents a lazy authentication case
So if the proactive authentication is disabled then the access will be denied if the resource is secured ? I think this is what you said earlier would happen in such a case, which makes sense
Was just about to ask what it means and then saw AUTH_FAILURE_HANDLER docs :-)
Which flow is it, reactive route without RestEasy ?
